name: CouenneSparseBndVec
brief:
Sparse vector with O(1) initialization for bound tracking

Efficient sparse+dense hybrid data structure for tracking which
variables had bounds tightened. Avoids O(n) initialization cost.

**Data structure (Briggs-Torczon):**
- dInd_[0..n_-1]: Dense list of assigned indices
- sInd_[i]: Position of index i in dense list (garbage if unset)
- data_[i]: Value at index i (garbage if unset)

**Key operations:**
- operator[](i): O(1) access, auto-initializes new entries
- reset(): O(1) clear (just set n_ = 0)
- nElements(): Number of assigned entries
- indices()/data(): Access for iteration

**Why useful in FBBT:**
In bound tightening, typically k << n variables have bounds
tightened. This structure allows O(k) iteration over tightened
bounds without O(n) initialization/cleanup overhead.

**Note:**
Valgrind will complain about uninitialized reads - this is expected
due to the lazy initialization design.
see: CouenneFixPoint which uses this for bound change tracking
